raw_content:
Understood. I will analyze the provided code representations to identify confirmed user-controlled sources and dangerous sinks. I will trace both intra-procedural and inter-procedural data flows to determine whether untrusted input can reach sensitive operations. Only those elements I can confirm based on the given code will be included in the final output. I will output my findings using raw JSON object ONLY, listing confirmed sources (function name and parameter) and confirmed sinks (fully qualified dangerous functions).

Here is my analysis:

```json
{
  "confirmed_sinks": [
    "os.system",
    "subprocess.Popen",
    "os.path.exists"
  ],
  "confirmed_sources": [
    {"function": "com1", "parameter": "username" },
    {"function": "com2", "parameter": "filename" },
    {"function": "show_user", "parameter": "request" },
    {"function": "show_user", "parameter": "username" },
    {"function": "path_exists", "parameter": "filename" }
  ]
}
```

In this analysis, I have identified the following confirmed user-controlled sources:
- `com1` function with parameter `username`
- `com2` function with parameter `filename`
- `show_user` function with parameter `request`
- `show_user` function with parameter `username`
- `path_exists` function with parameter `filename`

And the following confirmed dangerous sinks:
- `os.system`
- `subprocess.Popen`
- `os.path.exists`
